overview: This compilation of clips from the swing years (1932-1944) features the music of the artists who made the era great, from Penny Edwards to Harry Cool. Songs include "I Want a Big Fat Mama" by Lucky Milltinder and his orchestra; "Two Guitars and Dark Eyes" by Emery Deutsch and his orchestra; "Barn Dance Frolics" by Frank Novak's Rootin' Tooters; and "Coffee Shop Rhythm" by Paula Kelly and the Glenn Miller Modemaires.
title: The Swing Years: Sweet Lorraine
